thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Deutsche Bank to Cut Thousands of Jobs

author: Euan Conley
title: Deutsche Bank to Cut Thousands of Jobs
text:
FRANKFURT—Deutsche Bank AG on Thursday confirmed plans to cut thousands of jobs, and the troubled lender’s shares fell sharply following an update on investment-banking strategy and a warning from new Chief Executive Christian Sewing about continuing challenges.
The German bank said its headcount would fall “well below” 90,000 by the end of 2019, from its current workforce of about 97,000 employees. In its equities sales and trading business, executives said they have already begun reducing headcount by about 25%.
... RELATED VIDEO A Brief History of Retail Banking The retail banking industry is undergoing another major shift, and the future looks high-tech, sophisticated, and, for big banks, very urban. So what has changed? Photo: Shaumbé Wright/The Wall Street Journal
